                AP Photo

            By 
Nick Gass

10/02/15 10:10 AM EDT
Donald Trump "doesn't know what he's talking about" when he talks about Marco Rubio's relationship with Jeb Bush, the Florida senator said Friday.
While campaigning, the real-estate mogul has said on multiple occasions that the two Floridian GOP candidates "hate each other."
Story Continued Below
"I have great admiration for Governor Bush. We're friends. We're running for the same office. I'm not running against him, I'm running for president. It doesn't change my feelings towards him as a person. You don't have to hate the people you're running against, and in the case of Governor Bush who I've known for a very long time, I admire him, and we're friends," Rubio said in an interview with "America's Newsroom" on Fox News. "But we're competitors now, too, and we can do that in a way that I think is deserving of what the American people deserve in this election cycle.
During a campaign stop in New Hampshire earlier in the week, Trump claimed that the two Florida men hate each other "so much" and that "it's political bullsh--."
Asked what he thought Trump was trying to do by pitting them against each other, Rubio demurred.
“I have no idea. Who knows, with Donald, what he’s trying to do," he said. "Who cares?"

Off Message

            By 
Glenn Thrush

Bush, the governor of Florida from 1999 to 2007, took on Rubio by name on Thursday, telling MSNBC's "Morning Joe" that the former state senator's leadership skills are not fully known, unlike his.
"Look we had a president who came in and said the same kind of thing — new and improved, hope and change — and he didn't have the leadership skills to fix things," Bush said.
 © 2015 POLITICO LLC
title: Rubio: Trump doesn't know about my relationship with Bush
